item.description:
My powers of weather prediction tell me this day will be cloudy and rainy.  So how about we have a lazy afternoon of playing classical card games and watching some movies?  Maybe then I will finally be able to start competing in Cinemaplexity...

I'm thinking we could explore games like Canasta, Euchre and Pinochle while watching old movies like Davy Crocket.  But if that isn't your cup of tea, please make some card game and movie suggestions and we'll do it by popular vote.

Of course, if this Sunday turns out to be a beautiful Spring day, we'll go outside instead and throw a frisbee around.  Or else reschedule this event for another time... like say the dead of winter.

 

----------------------------

This is a Mini-Meetup. Anyone can sign up, but I would please ask that you allow new or previously inactive members get a slot if they are on the waiting list since there is limited seating.  Thanks. See this discussion for more details.

----------------------------

 

Food theme: 

The theme for this event will be something that can double as a movie genre.  For example, you can bring "western" food, you can bring "foreign" food.  Please bring something that fits in a movie genre and as always you are free to interpret that however you want.  I will try to have also generic, healthy snacks on hand for all diets.

 

About the location: 
This event will be hosted at a private residence, conveniently located at the intersections of Route 1 and Route 95.  If you need directions, just ask.  This is a housing complex, so please do NOT park in any numbered spaces.  There are no animals on the premises.

group.name: The Salem Board Games Meetup Group

item.name: Mini-Meetup: Cards and Movies
